snippet: Swimming’s governing body is preparing to set a maximum water temperature for open-water events after an American swimmer died during a sweltering race in 2010.
abstract: Swimming’s governing body is preparing to set a maximum water temperature of 87.8 degrees for open-water events; absence of fix limit came under scrutiny when an American swimmer died during a sweltering 10-kilometer race in 2010 in the United Arab Emirates.
lead_paragraph: Swimming’s governing body is preparing to set a maximum water temperature for open-water events after an American swimmer died during a sweltering race in 2010.
